verses.verse: Thou shalt not <WH3808> see <WH7200> <WH853> thy brother's <WH251> ox <WH7794> or <WH176> <WH853> his sheep <WH7716> go astray, <WH5080> and hide thyself <WH5956> from <WH4480> them: thou shalt in any case bring them again <WH7725> <WH7725> unto thy brother. <WH251>

And if <WH518> thy brother <WH251> be not <WH3808> nigh <WH7138> unto <WH413> thee, or if thou know <WH3045> him not, <WH3808> then thou shalt bring <WH622> it unto <WH413> <WH8432> thine own house, <WH1004> and it shall be <WH1961> with <WH5973> thee until <WH5704> thy brother <WH251> seek after <WH1875> it, and thou shalt restore <WH7725> it to him again.

In like manner <WH3651> shalt thou do <WH6213> with his ass; <WH2543> and so <WH3651> shalt thou do <WH6213> with his raiment; <WH8071> and with all <WH3605> lost thing <WH9> of thy brother's, <WH251> which <WH834> he hath lost, <WH6> and thou hast found, <WH4672> shalt thou do <WH6213> likewise: <WH3651> thou mayest <WH3201> not <WH3808> hide thyself. <WH5956>

Thou shalt not <WH3808> see <WH7200> <WH853> thy brother's <WH251> ass <WH2543> or <WH176> his ox <WH7794> fall down <WH5307> by the way, <WH1870> and hide thyself <WH5956> from <WH4480> them: thou shalt surely help him to lift them up again. <WH6965> <WH6965> <WH5973>

The woman <WH802> shall not <WH3808> wear <WH1961> that which pertaineth <WH3627> unto a man, <WH1397> neither <WH3808> shall a man <WH1397> put on <WH3847> a woman's <WH802> garment: <WH8071> for <WH3588> all <WH3605> that do <WH6213> so <WH428> are abomination <WH8441> unto the LORD <WH3068> thy God. <WH430>

If <WH3588> a bird's <WH6833> nest <WH7064> chance to be <WH7122> before <WH6440> thee in the way <WH1870> in any <WH3605> tree, <WH6086> or <WH176> on <WH5921> the ground, <WH776> whether they be young ones, <WH667> or <WH176> eggs, <WH1000> and the dam <WH517> sitting <WH7257> upon <WH5921> the young, <WH667> or <WH176> upon <WH5921> the eggs, <WH1000> thou shalt not <WH3808> take <WH3947> the dam <WH517> with <WH5921> the young: <WH1121>

But thou shalt in any wise <WH7971> <WH853> let the dam <WH517> go, <WH7971> and take <WH3947> the young <WH1121> to thee; that <WH4616> it may be well <WH3190> with thee, and that thou mayest prolong <WH748> thy days. <WH3117>

When <WH3588> thou buildest <WH1129> a new <WH2319> house, <WH1004> then thou shalt make <WH6213> a battlement <WH4624> for thy roof, <WH1406> that thou bring <WH7760> not <WH3808> blood <WH1818> upon thine house, <WH1004> if <WH3588> any man <WH5307> fall <WH5307> from <WH4480> thence.

Thou shalt not <WH3808> sow <WH2232> thy vineyard <WH3754> with divers seeds: <WH3610> lest <WH6435> the fruit <WH4395> of thy seed <WH2233> which <WH834> thou hast sown, <WH2232> and the fruit <WH8393> of thy vineyard, <WH3754> be defiled. <WH6942>
Thou shalt not <WH3808> plow <WH2790> with an ox <WH7794> and an ass <WH2543> together. <WH3162>
Thou shalt not <WH3808> wear <WH3847> a garment of divers sorts, <WH8162> as of woolen <WH6785> and linen <WH6593> together. <WH3162>
Thou shalt make <WH6213> thee fringes <WH1434> upon <WH5921> the four <WH702> quarters <WH3671> of thy vesture, <WH3682> wherewith <WH834> thou coverest <WH3680> thyself.
If <WH3588> any man <WH376> take <WH3947> a wife, <WH802> and go in <WH935> unto <WH413> her, and hate <WH8130> her,

And give <WH7760> occasions <WH5949> of speech <WH1697> against her, and bring up <WH3318> an evil <WH7451> name <WH8034> upon <WH5921> her, and say, <WH559> I took <WH3947> <WH853> this <WH2063> woman, <WH802> and when I came <WH7126> to <WH413> her, I found <WH4672> her not <WH3808> a maid: <WH1331>

Then shall the father <WH1> of the damsel, <WH5291> and her mother, <WH517> take <WH3947> and bring forth <WH3318> <WH853> the tokens of the damsel's <WH5291> virginity <WH1331> unto <WH413> the elders <WH2205> of the city <WH5892> in the gate: <WH8179>

And the damsel's <WH5291> father <WH1> shall say <WH559> unto <WH413> the elders, <WH2205> I gave <WH5414> <WH853> my daughter <WH1323> unto this <WH2088> man <WH376> to wife, <WH802> and he hateth <WH8130> her;

And, lo, <WH2009> he <WH1931> hath given <WH7760> occasions <WH5949> of speech <WH1697> against her, saying, <WH559> I found <WH4672> not <WH3808> thy daughter <WH1323> a maid; <WH1331> and yet these <WH428> are the tokens of my daughter's <WH1323> virginity. <WH1331> And they shall spread <WH6566> the cloth <WH8071> before <WH6440> the elders <WH2205> of the city. <WH5892>
And the elders <WH2205> of that <WH1931> city <WH5892> shall take <WH3947> <WH853> that man <WH376> and chastise <WH3256> him;

And they shall amerce <WH6064> him in a hundred <WH3967> shekels of silver, <WH3701> and give <WH5414> them unto the father <WH1> of the damsel, <WH5291> because <WH3588> he hath brought up <WH3318> an evil <WH7451> name <WH8034> upon <WH5921> a virgin <WH1330> of Israel: <WH3478> and she shall be <WH1961> his wife; <WH802> he may <WH3201> not <WH3808> put her away <WH7971> all <WH3605> his days. <WH3117>
But if <WH518> this <WH2088> thing <WH1697> be <WH1961> true, <WH571> and the tokens of virginity <WH1331> be not <WH3808> found <WH4672> for the damsel: <WH5291>

Then they shall bring out <WH3318> <WH853> the damsel <WH5291> to <WH413> the door <WH6607> of her father's <WH1> house, <WH1004> and the men <WH376> of her city <WH5892> shall stone <WH5619> her with stones <WH68> that she die: <WH4191> because <WH3588> she hath wrought <WH6213> folly <WH5039> in Israel, <WH3478> to play the whore <WH2181> in her father's <WH1> house: <WH1004> so shalt thou put evil away <WH1197> <WH7451> from among <WH4480> <WH7130> you.

If <WH3588> a man <WH376> be found <WH4672> lying <WH7901> with <WH5973> a woman <WH802> married <WH1166> to a husband, <WH1167> then they shall both <WH1571> <WH8147> of them die, <WH4191> both the man <WH376> that lay <WH7901> with <WH5973> the woman, <WH802> and the woman: <WH802> so shalt thou put away <WH1197> evil <WH7451> from Israel. <WH4480> <WH3478>

If <WH3588> a damsel <WH5291> that is a virgin <WH1330> be <WH1961> betrothed <WH781> unto a husband, <WH376> and a man <WH376> find <WH4672> her in the city, <WH5892> and lie <WH7901> with <WH5973> her;

Then ye shall bring them both out <WH3318> <WH853> <WH8147> unto <WH413> the gate <WH8179> of that <WH1931> city, <WH5892> and ye shall stone <WH5619> them with stones <WH68> that they die; <WH4191> <WH853> the damsel, <WH5291> because <WH5921> <WH1697> <WH834> she cried <WH6817> not, <WH3808> being in the city; <WH5892> and the man, <WH376> because <WH5921> <WH1697> <WH834> he hath humbled <WH6031> <WH853> his neighbor's <WH7453> wife: <WH802> so thou shalt put away <WH1197> evil <WH7451> from among <WH4480> <WH7130> you.

But if <WH518> a man <WH376> find <WH4672> <WH853> a betrothed <WH781> damsel <WH5291> in the field, <WH7704> and the man <WH376> force <WH2388> her, and lie <WH7901> with <WH5973> her: then the man <WH376> only <WH905> that <WH834> lay <WH7901> with <WH5973> her shall die: <WH4191>

But unto the damsel <WH5291> thou shalt do <WH6213> nothing; <WH3808> <WH1697> there is in the damsel <WH5291> no <WH369> sin <WH2399> worthy of death: <WH4194> for <WH3588> as <WH834> when a man <WH376> riseth <WH6965> against <WH5921> his neighbor, <WH7453> and slayeth <WH7523> <WH5315> him, even so <WH3651> is this <WH2088> matter: <WH1697>
For <WH3588> he found <WH4672> her in the field, <WH7704> and the betrothed <WH781> damsel <WH5291> cried, <WH6817> and there was none <WH369> to save <WH3467> her.

If <WH3588> a man <WH376> find <WH4672> a damsel <WH5291> that is a virgin, <WH1330> which <WH834> is not <WH3808> betrothed, <WH781> and lay hold <WH8610> on her, and lie <WH7901> with <WH5973> her, and they be found; <WH4672>

Then the man <WH376> that lay <WH7901> with <WH5973> her shall give <WH5414> unto the damsel's <WH5291> father <WH1> fifty <WH2572> shekels of silver, <WH3701> and she shall be <WH1961> his wife; <WH802> because <WH8478> <WH834> he hath humbled <WH6031> her, he may <WH3201> not <WH3808> put her away <WH7971> all <WH3605> his days. <WH3117>
A man <WH376> shall not <WH3808> take <WH3947> <WH853> his father's <WH1> wife, <WH802> nor <WH3808> discover <WH1540> his father's <WH1> skirt. <WH3671>
